intro: Polygala vulgaris subsp. gerundensis, commonly known as the common milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish or greenish flowers arranged in spikes. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which is characterized by its unique floral structures. The subspecies gerundensis is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and geographic distribution compared to the typical form of Polygala vulgaris.
